Therefore, the chef must be in column 3, and the fan of R&B must be in column 2.
* From clue 1, the owner of the cat is the person watching comedy movies. This means the person watching comedy movies is in column 2 or 3 (since the Russian already has a pet). But since the Egyptian is on the right, and the cat cannot be owned by the Russian (column 1), it must be owned by the German (column 2).
* The only remaining job is the designer, which must be in column 2.
* Finally, from clue 3, the fan of D&B is on the left of the person watching comedy movies. This means the D&B fan (in column 3) is indeed on the right of the person watching documentary movies (column 1), and the person watching Western movies (column 2) is between them.
